twcore.core.util
Class MapRegions

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.util.MapRegions

public class MapRegions
extends java.lang.Object

Very easy way to check if a player is in a certain part of the map. Can be any shape or size, and you don't have to be a programmer to use it because you can just draw on a map where you want things to be. How it works is it reads in an image where each pixel is a tile on the map. When you specify an (x, y) coordinate, it retrieves the color of that pixel from the image. This color is then checked against defined region colors. All calculations are done in RGB, I recommend using a .png image with the web-safe palette. The image HAS to be either GIF, PNG, or JPEG.

Version:
06.06.20
Author:
D1st0rt (Original credit for concept of this system to Dr Brain)

public void loadRegionImage(java.lang.String filename)

Loads the region file for this arena from the /data/maps folder, with a specified filename.

Parameters:

Throws:

loadRegionCfg

public BotSettings loadRegionCfg(java.lang.String filename)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Helper function for loading region settings that follow a basic formatting convention:
Region0=(red 0-255),(green 0-255),blue(0-255)
Region(n)=...

Returns:
The cfg file in case there is other information to get from it

checkRegion

public boolean checkRegion(int x,
                           int y,
                           int region)
Checks to see if a point is within a specified region Evaluates the color of their position against the color of the region

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate (in tiles)
y - The y coordinate (in tiles)
region - the index of the region to check against
Returns:
true if point is in region, false if not
